title: Analysis | Fact-checking the first Democratic debate (night 2)
subtitle: Here's a round-up of 14 claims from the second round of the first Democratic presidential debate of 2020.
author: www.washingtonpost.com
vclaim: “The real scandal here is that the bottom half of the U.S. families owns essentially no wealth on net, because debts cancel out whatever small assets they may have, on average," he said in an email. "If you exclude cars (consumer durables), the wealth of the bottom 50% is actually slightly negative according to the most recent distributional Fed statistics (2019-Q1). You don’t even need to be a billionaire to actually own more than what the bottom half of Americans own! Billionaires in the Forbes 400 owned slightly less than 1% of total wealth back in 1982, they now own about 3.5% of total wealth (Zucman, 2019, Figure 3). That’s another alarming trend.”
